page.title: 04FINZEAN ATTITUDES.
page.content: Many families,having lived in Finean for generations,form the nucleus of a {genuinely caring community,}protective of the elderly,the troubled and the young.Local amenities are appreciated and respected;there is no vandalism. The Laird and the 'elder statesmen' keep an unofficial but firm grip on the well-being and development of the community. With the advent of{private building- and the{oil industry}in Aberdeen- an influx of residents with a more sophisticated,cosmopolitan outlook came in to provide a mix. A vigilant {Community Association}provides a forum for the discussion of social concerns- planning,conservation, amenities,being involved in the provision of{road {signs, sheltered housing and street {lighting.
